svcproc.title: MAINTENANCE
svcproc.para: Use the following guidelines for shutter maintenance:

item.para: CLEANING: Clean debris from the shutter assembly DAILY.
SALT PROTECTION: For winter operation where roadways are chemically treated, protect moving parts of the shutter assembly with an OIL FILM COATING.

AIR RECIRCULATION SHIELD: For effective temperature control, the shutters must control all the air flowing through the radiator core. There must be NO OPENING in the recirculation shield allowing ram air to bypass the shutter vanes.
VANES: The shutter vanes should close firmly, WITHOUT LEAKING, or binding at the seal edge. Excessive leakage when the vanes are closed makes the radiator operate inefficiently.
CYLINDERS: Always check the cylinder for leaks before replacement by pressure testing the system. The only effective repair is REPLACEMENT.
